item.title: New stealthy Pumakit Linux rootkit malware spotted in the wild
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Linux rootkit malware called Pumakit has been discovered that uses stealth and advanced privilege escalation techniques to hide its presence on systems. [...]

item.title: Police shuts down Rydox cybercrime market, arrests 3 admins
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: International law enforcement operation seizes the Rydox cybercrime marketplace and arrests three administrators. [...]

item.title: New IOCONTROL malware used in critical infrastructure attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Iranian threat actors are utilizing a new malware named IOCONTROL to compromise Internet of Things (IoT) devices and OT/SCADA systems used by critical infrastructure in Israel and the United States. [...]

item.title: US offers $5 million for info on North Korean IT worker farms
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The U.S. State Department is offering a reward of up to $5 million for information that could help disrupt the activities of North Korean front companies and employees who generated over $88 million via illegal remote IT work schemes in six years. [...]

item.title: Cleo patches critical zero-day exploited in data theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cleo has released security updates for a zero-day flaw in its LexiCom, VLTransfer, and Harmony software, currently exploited in data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Spain busts voice phishing ring for defrauding 10,000 bank customers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Spanish police, working with colleagues in Peru, conducted a simultaneous crackdown on a large-scale voice phishing (vishing) scam ring in the two countries, arresting 83 individuals. [...]

item.title: Bitcoin ATM firm Byte Federal hacked via GitLab flaw, 58K users exposed
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: US Bitcoin ATM operator Byte Federal has disclosed a data breach that exposed the data of 58,000 customers after its systems were breached using a GitLab vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Hunk Companion WordPress plugin exploited to install vulnerable plugins
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are exploiting a critical vulnerability in the "Hunk Companion" plugin to install and activate other plugins with exploitable flaws directly from the WordPress.org repository. [...]

item.title: Cynet Delivers 100% Protection and 100% Detection Visibility in the 2024 MITRE ATT&CK Evaluation
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Cynet
item.description: The 2024 MITRE ATT&CK Evaluation results are now available with Cynet achieving 100% Visibility and 100% Protection in the 2024 evaluation. Learn more from Cynet about what these results mean. [...]

item.title: New EagleMsgSpy Android spyware used by Chinese police, researchers say
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A previously undocumented Android spyware called 'EagleMsgSpy' has been discovered and is believed to be used by law enforcement agencies in China to monitor mobile devices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft lifts Windows 11 24H2 block on PCs with USB scanners
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has lifted a compatibility block preventing Windows 11 24H2 upgrades after fixing a bug causing USB connection issues to some scanners. [...]

item.title: Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp hit by massive worldwide outage
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Facebook, Instagram, Threads, and WhatsApp suffered a massive worldwide Wednesday afternoon, with services impacted in varying degrees based on user's region. [...]
